New cases are in the Far North (19), North (4) and Saskatoon (3) regions
No (0) new cases were Saskatchewan residents tested out of province
415 cases are confirmed and none (0) are presumptive (referred to RRPL/NML for confirmatory testing)
112 cases out of the 415 cases are considered active (27%)

156 cases are from the Saskatoon area, 81 cases are from the north, 77 cases are in the far north, 75 cases are from the Regina area,  15 cases are from the south and 11 cases are from the central area
39 of the cases are individuals in the 19 and under age category; all others are adults, with 50% of the cases are males and 50% are females
138 of cases are travel-related, 163 are either contacts or linked to a mass gathering event, 38 have no known exposures and 76 are under investigation by local public health
40 cases are healthcare workers, although the source of their infections may not be health care related
A total of 10 individuals are hospitalized; including seven (7) inpatient hospitalizations and three (3) in ICU hospitalization
Six (6) Saskatchewan residents with COVID-19 have died. Saskatchewan now has a fatality rate of 1.4%
A total of 297 individuals have recovered (75.8%)
30,357 COVID-19 tests had been performed in Saskatchewan
